parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAOBJ

self.title: Findings About Object of the Observation

fields.completionInstructions: [Protocol specific]
fields.definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.
fields.implementationNotes: The FAOBJ will usually be preprinted or hidden, and not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.
fields.label: Findings About Object of the Observation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAOBJ
fields.questionText: [Sponsored-defined phrase]

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the there are findings. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the finding topic.
fields.implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, observations were done.
fields.label: Findings About Collected
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: FAYN
fields.questionText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the [FATESTs] was/were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
fields.label: Findings About Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: FAPERF
fields.questionText: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FATEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the FATEST if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Findings About Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.
fields.name: FATEST
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FATSTDTL

fields.completionInstructions: Record the detail of the [FATEST], if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.
fields.implementationNotes: It is recommended that the test detail name be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Findings About Test Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FATSTDTL
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FACAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FA category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Findings About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FACAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FASCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FA subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the FACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. FASCAT can only be used if there is a FACAT and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Findings About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FASCAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAPOS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of the subject during the Findings About Test
fields.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
fields.label: Findings About Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAPOS
fields.questionText: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/ test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection])?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: FA Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FATEST result.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: In most cases, the Question Text and Item Prompt for the FAORRES are specific to the FATEST. The value of FATEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Result" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: FA Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAORRES
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the unit of measure associated with the test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: The Question Text and Item Prompt for the FAORRESU may be specific to the FATEST. Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text (e.g., IN, LB, kg/L).
fields.label: FA Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAORRESU
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

implements.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Findings About Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAORNRLO

self.title: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the Findings About test.
fields.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in --ORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAORNRLO
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Findings About Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAORNRHI

self.title: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the Findings About test.
fields.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in --ORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: --ORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAORNRHI
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FANRIND

fields.completionInstructions: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by FAORNRLO, FAORNRHI, FASTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Findings About Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FANRIND
fields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FASTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the [FATEST] measurement was not done.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH FAPERF field. Typically a check box which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: Findings About Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for FAREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
fields.name: FASTAT
fields.questionText: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated ]?; Indicate if the([--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why a Finding About test was not collected.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Findings About Reason Not Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAREASND
fields.questionText: Was the [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FASPEC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type.
fields.definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: Findings About Specimen Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FASPEC
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the specimen type?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FASPCCND

fields.completionInstructions: Record condition of specimen.
fields.definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When Local Processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.
fields.label: Findings About Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FASPCCND
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FALOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Example: ARM for blood pressure. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Location of the Finding About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FALOC
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination]) or What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen] was taken/collected)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FALAT

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Laterality of Location of the Finding About

self.title: Laterality of Location of Finding About

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the [FATEST] measurement.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Laterality of Location of Finding About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FALAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FADIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Findings About Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FADIR
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Findings About Location Portion or Totality

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAPORTOT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the Findings About.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations of the location of the FATEST. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: FA Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAPORTOT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used to measure Findings About test.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.label: Findings About Method
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FALEAD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lead used to measure Findings About test.
fields.definition: The lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument.
fields.label: Findings About Lead
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FALEAD
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Findings About Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAFAST
fields.questionText: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Findings About Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAEVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FAEVALID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in FAEVAL.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used in conjunction with FAEVAL to provide an additional level of detail.
fields.label: Findings About Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: FAEVALID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase-information)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field FA.FACLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether [FATEST] result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant
fields.label: Findings About Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPFA dataset as the value of SUPPFA.QVAL when SUPPFA.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPFA.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: FACLSIG
fields.questionText: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination]) result clinically significant?
